1.t: When the heavens are rent asunder,

4.t: and the graves are turned inside out,

5.t: every soul will see the result of its deeds - those recorded before his death and those which will produce either virtue or evil after his death.

6.t: Human being, what evil has deceived you about your Gracious Lord,
6.tr: Yaaa-ayyuhal insaaanu maa gharraka bi-Rabbikal kareem

7.t: Who created you proportionately and fashioned you

8.tr: Feee ayye sooratim maa shaaa'a rakkabak

9.t: Despite this, you deny the Day of Judgment,

10.t: but you should know that there are angelic guards

12.t: and these honorable scribes know whatever you do.

13.t: The virtuous ones will live in bliss

14.t: and the evil-doers will be in hell

15.t: which they will enter on the Day of Judgment

17.t: They will never be able to escape from it. Would that you knew what the Day of Judgment is!

18.t: Again would that you only knew how terrible it really is!
18.tr: Summa maaa adraaka maa Yawmud Deen

19.t: On that day, no soul will be of any benefit to any other soul. On that day, all affairs will be in the hands of God.
19.tr: Yawma laa tamliku nafsul linafsin shai'anw walamru yawma'izil lillaah
